Description: Gold finger-ring; Egyptian or Egyptianising type with swivelling bezel; round-sectioned hoop tapering slightly towards splayed, pierced ends; bezel swivelled around a wire inserted through the pierced ends and block-twisted around the hoop; bezel is of scaraboid form set in a gold mounting with tubes soldered at ends; scaraboid of blue glazed composition.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Finger Ring / Catalogue of the Finger Rings, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum (280)
